meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of Pithecanthropus, an extinct genus of hominins.
meanings.sent1: The pithecanthropine skull was studied by scientists to learn more about our ancient relatives.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed a collection of pithecanthropine artifacts found during the excavation.
meanings.sent3: The pithecanthropine fossils were so old, they seemed to tell stories of ancient times.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes had a pithecanthropine gaze, as if looking back through centuries of history.
meanings.sent5: The pithecanthropine features of the skeleton were carefully examined by the archaeologists.

meanings.definition: A member of the genus Pithecanthropus.
meanings.sent1: The pithecanthropine was believed to have walked upright like modern humans.
meanings.sent2: Researchers discovered a new pithecanthropine fossil in the remote cave.
meanings.sent3: The playful pithecanthropine swung from tree to tree, showing off its agility.
meanings.sent4: In the crowded museum, the pithecanthropine statue stood out among the exhibits.
meanings.sent5: Children were fascinated by the pithecanthropine model, imagining life in ancient times.
